She's not powerful because she is an enchanter. She's powerful because she's by her very nature a low death champion. That's it. She stays at safe ranges, takes about 10-13 k total damage a game. It has nothing to do with the scaling or cooldowns or CC influence of her kit. It has to do with the fact bounty scores in games with her = basically 5v4 Bounty possibilities. 

It's the same problem that occurs when someone leaves a game: 4 people can carry the game for awhile..... because they are sharing XP with less people, not giving up as much shutdown gold as their opponents are, and have a clear objective: preventing lane pushes.

Most supports die. Nami doesn't.

e.e you realize enchanters are meant to be anti-die champions right... That's why I said she's the only enchanter left. Nami is now the only support champion that can keep a champion consistently alive while allowing the ADC to do the trading. All the other supports right now are either disengage kings that double function as lockdown tanks, like Alistar, Leona, and Pyke (his passive and his E dash allow him to function very well as a damage absorber/disengage unit when required during laning phase). Bounty phases don't play as large of a role as you think, because Nami's W and Ignite will net about the same amount of kills as a Leona's W's shield popping and a Leona's Q's empowered auto. That's not the main issue, it's that everyone hated the enchanter playstyle for so long because they were TOO good at trading and disengage and healing, but now that they've mostly been gutted, Nami's the last one left.

No. Her healing someone has nothing to do with her win rate. It's an ENTIRELY different argument. SHE doesn't die. When I'm playing Nami, I rarely die more than twice.

Nami actually sucks at keeping others alive. Meta builds only heal about 1/4 or less of a health bar or less, depending on who it is, and it's on a base 10 second cooldown. So at best, it's a 6 second skill. Ie, in combat, it's not spammable. After she uses it, you have 6+ seconds to kill her/her allies. And that's just in mechanics. That doesn't include diminishing heals from grievous wounds. 

Soraka and Sona can BOTH keep people alive better, with what ends up being lower cooldowns and much more influential abilities.

When hits are 600-950 regularly, and heals are 272..... the heal is a joke. It rarely saves the target, unless the other team is dramatically behind.

Bounties play a HUGE role. Nami can take kills, but not give them back. If Leona or Pyke or Alistar takes kills, they DO give them back. The Nami might net 575 gold in bounties an entire game. Leona will probably net about 1500 gold in bounties (5 kill trades, 5 deaths). Pyke will probably net closer to 2500-4000 in bounties a game, since his entire purpose is to steal kills, and often in sequence. Alistar is iffy and depends on how early the opposing team gets grievous wounds. If they don't, he likely gives 1500 -2000 in bounties. If they do, more.

Also, Nami generally doesn't take Ignite. She exhausts.
